title: Equivariant cohomology
summary: In mathematics, equivariant cohomology (or Borel cohomology) is a cohomology theory from algebraic topology which applies to topological spaces with a group action.  It can be viewed as a common generalization of group cohomology and an ordinary cohomology theory. Specifically, the equivariant cohomology ring of a space X {\displaystyle X} with action of a topological group G {\displaystyle G} is defined as the ordinary cohomology ring with coefficient ring Λ {\displaystyle \Lambda } of the homotopy quotient E G × G X {\displaystyle EG\times _{G}X} :
